Sequence Information.Peptide Name: VM-3G (VM P3G analog, Leu-rich, synthetic AMPs, XXA, UCLL1c; BBMm)
Sequence Information.Source: amino acid substitution, insects, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (92.31%) toVCP-VT1 or VML: 38%, G: 23%, I: 15%.Activity: Active against Gram+ S. aureus NCTC 6538 or MRSA ATCC 12493 (MIC 1-2 uM), E. faecalis NCTC 12697 (MIC 4 uM), Gram- E. coli ATCC 8739 (MIC 64 uM), K.pneumoniae ATCC 43816 (MIC 512 uM), P.aeruginosa ATCC 9027 (MIC >128 uM), and yeast C. albicans ATCC 10231 (MIC >512 uM). Also inhibited biofilms:bacteria:S. aureus (MBIC 2 uM; MBEC 32 uM); biofilms:bacteria:E. faecalis (MBIC 8 uM).MOA:bacteria:S. aureus: it permeabilized bacterial membranes (2xMIC, 50%).Structure:  random coil in 10 mM NH4Ac and helical in 50% TFE/NH4Ac.In vitro toxicity: horse RBC: HC50 9.7 uM, hemolytic.Animal model:wax moth: survival study: it protected the worms from death in a dose-dependent manner.Resistance development:no:bacteria:S. aureus: no resistance development after 16 cycles of passages.
Literature Information.Author: Zhang J, Sun R, Chen Z, Zhou C, Ma C, Zhou M, Chen X, Chen T, Shaw C, Wang L.2022
Literature Information.Title: Evaluation of the Antimicrobial Properties of a Natural Peptide from Vespa mandarinia Venom and Its Synthetic Analogues as a Possible Route to Defeat Drug-Resistant Microbes.
